content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#"   xmlns:odo="http://ocean-data.org/schema/"   xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/terms/"   xmlns:void="http://rdfs.org/ns/void#"   xmlns:dcat="http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#"   xmlns:rdfs="http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#">    <rdf:Description rdf:about="http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-deployment/552261">     <rdf:type rdf:resource="http://ocean-data.org/schema/DeploymentDataset"/>     <rdf:type rdf:resource="http://www.w3.org/ns/dcat#Dataset"/>     <odo:hasDatasetURL rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#anyURI">http://www.bco-dmo.org/dataset-deployment/552261/data</odo:hasDatasetURL>     <odo:hasDataset rdf:resource="http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset/3604"/>     <odo:fromCollection rdf:resource="http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset/3604"/>     <odo:fromDeployment rdf:resource="http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/deployment/541971"/>     <odo:hasAcquisitionDescription rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#HTML"><div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" lang="en"><p>Peter Wiebe's hand-written notes from MOCNESS ship log book regarding tapes, etc.\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd<br /> transcribed Mar. 1, 2004 NJC<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> Ship speed ~2 knots for all tows<br /> Both \ufffd\ufffd" and 9-track tape-recorded most tows.<br /> Mesh opening of nets = 333 microns<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /><strong>CH125 Aug. 1975</strong><br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M1\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSargasso Sea to 200m, night.\ufffd\ufffd Station 2. Aug. 4, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd Tow ok.\ufffd\ufffd All angles are high by 8 \ufffd\ufffd<br /> degrees and volumes could be low by 15%.\ufffd\ufffd Net 1 sampled between 100 and 195m a bit extra \ufffd\ufffd<br /> due to level wind problem on GEOSECS winch: 2035 wire paid out to get level wind fixed: 191m \ufffd\ufffd<br /> down to 194m coming in slowly: only paid out for 1 minute or so.\ufffd\ufffd 2037: stopped again at 194-<br /> 195m. 2037: coming in again.\ufffd\ufffd Net 2 fired ok.\ufffd\ufffd Net 3 fired ok.\ufffd\ufffd 2055: wire coming in at 10m/min.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd<br /> For most of tow, wire in at 10m/min.\ufffd\ufffd Note: net 8 fill of radiolarian colonies.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M2\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSargasso Sea to 800m, night.\ufffd\ufffd Station 2. Aug. 4, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd Tow ok.\ufffd\ufffd All angles are high by 8 \ufffd\ufffd<br /> degrees and volumes could be low by 15%.\ufffd\ufffd Net 0 sent down to 955 (1600 meters wire out) then \ufffd\ufffd<br /> held there until angle and depth stabilized.\ufffd\ufffd Tape recorder #9984 turned on at 2323 with net 2 \ufffd\ufffd<br /> open.\ufffd\ufffd We forgot to turn it on at bottom of tow.\ufffd\ufffd Note: every time we push net command, angle \ufffd\ufffd<br /> changes dramatically by increasing also net response is not working and hasn't since beginning \ufffd\ufffd<br /> of tow (as net 4 opens).<br /> \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdTow was successful \ufffd\ufffd all 9 nets were successfully opened and closed at the right depths.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd<br /> The net response indicator was tripped 8 times while shooting the net at ~50m/min while \ufffd\ufffd<br /> steaming between 1.2-1.6 knots.\ufffd\ufffd During shooting, MOCNESS angle was ~18 deg.\ufffd\ufffd We paid out \ufffd\ufffd<br /> 1600 m wire and then speeded ship up to 1.9-2.0 kts and then let net which sank to 950+ m fly up \ufffd\ufffd<br /> to 800m.\ufffd\ufffd At 800m, net 1 was opened.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdNet response failed to work for entire hauling sequence.\ufffd\ufffd However, we could see when a \ufffd\ufffd<br /> net was tripped by a radical momentary increase in the frame angle.\ufffd\ufffd Flow far each net will have \ufffd\ufffd<br /> to be calculated by difference but estimates should be as good as if the net response had worked \ufffd\ufffd<br /> properly.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdOn this tow, we had planned to start the tape recorder at the time when net 1 was \ufffd\ufffd<br /> opened but we forgot and Polloni discovered our mistake during the time net 2 was opened.\ufffd\ufffd This \ufffd\ufffd<br /> set of samples was beautiful.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M3\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSargasso Sea to 200m, day.\ufffd\ufffd Station 2.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 5, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd All angles are high by 8 degrees \ufffd\ufffd<br /> and volumes could be low by 15%.\ufffd\ufffd We got net responses while shooting the net wire angle \ufffd\ufffd<br /> dropped off to 30 before I had ship speed up to 2.0 kts. Start haul coming n at 10m/min.\ufffd\ufffd Net 1 \ufffd\ufffd<br /> response: net 2 response: net 3 response \ufffd\ufffd got good net response until net 8 (top net \ufffd\ufffd no \ufffd\ufffd<br /> response).\ufffd\ufffd Also got spurious responses (13, 14, 15) between nets 7 &amp; 8 (angle dropped to 38 \ufffd\ufffd<br /> deg about this time).\ufffd\ufffd Note: snap hook holding bottom of net 6 and top of net 5 broke off.\ufffd\ufffd Nets \ufffd\ufffd<br /> had reasonable collections but catches shouldn't be considered quantitative.\ufffd\ufffd No apparent reason \ufffd\ufffd<br /> for snap hook failure. [see M4 note]<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M4\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSargasso Sea to 800m, day. Station 2.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 5, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd All angles are high by 8 degrees \ufffd\ufffd<br /> and volumes could be low by 15%.\ufffd\ufffd Net 5 response in shooting net right at surface.\ufffd\ufffd Ship's speed \ufffd\ufffd<br /> too slow!\ufffd\ufffd 2 more responses at 175m.\ufffd\ufffd We had a hard time getting the net at depth of 800m.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd<br /> Note: the angle of the CTD sensor was corrected after this tow.\ufffd\ufffd It was 53 deg. rather than 45 \ufffd\ufffd<br /> deg.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd1700: This is probably the best MOCNESS haul to date.\ufffd\ufffd Wire was brought in at 35m/min \ufffd\ufffd<br /> and nets fished each depth interval very uniformly.\ufffd\ufffd There were no major screw ups except that \ufffd\ufffd<br /> the net response indicator still is being tripped by the nets' sides in shooting and right at the \ufffd\ufffd<br /> surface at the end of the haul.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdIn shooting, the problem appears to be that the net is moving through the water too \ufffd\ufffd<br /> slowly.\ufffd\ufffd I.e. at 1.5 to 2.0 kts and 50m/min pay-out.\ufffd\ufffd The net is moving forward about 46.5-<br /> 41=5.5m/min or 62-41=21 m/min whish is \ufffd\ufffd to 1 kt \ufffd\ufffd far too slow.\ufffd\ufffd The solution is to shoot the net \ufffd\ufffd<br /> with the ship moving ahead at 3 kts at 50m/min to give a net speed of 1.5 kts.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd2100: Must now way that this was not best tow.\ufffd\ufffd Net 4 was ripped almost all the way \ufffd\ufffd<br /> across the top and the snap hook holding bottom of net 4 and top of net 3 on net release indicator \ufffd\ufffd<br /> side broke off.\ufffd\ufffd Snap hook was caught between nets.\ufffd\ufffd Did it happen at the surface?? Catch for \ufffd\ufffd<br /> both nets 3 and 4 looked ok.\ufffd\ufffd We modified the net response indicator.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M5\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdRing station to 800m, night.\ufffd\ufffd Station 3.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 7, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd First start at 1956 but flow meter \ufffd\ufffd<br /> hung up.\ufffd\ufffd Brought net up and fixed flowmeter.\ufffd\ufffd Second start down at 2010.\ufffd\ufffd On this tow we \ufffd\ufffd<br /> started net going down ~15m/min and ship speed ~2.5 kts.\ufffd\ufffd When net was at 70m depth, sped \ufffd\ufffd<br /> ship up to 3.0 kts and paid out at 50m/min.\ufffd\ufffd Once wire was at \ufffd\ufffd.(angle probably off by 8 deg).\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd<br /> Tape change at 2149.\ufffd\ufffd No net response on nets 6 or 7.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd[Did not get data transferred from 9-track tapes: njc 3/1/04]<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M6\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdRing station to 200m, night.\ufffd\ufffd Station 3.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 7, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd Good set.\ufffd\ufffd No net responses.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd<br /> Down at 35m/min, in at 15m/min.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M7\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdRing station to 200m, day.\ufffd\ufffd Station 3.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 8, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd We got two net responses when we \ufffd\ufffd<br /> first started net down, so we brought net back up to the surface to check it.\ufffd\ufffd Net responses were \ufffd\ufffd<br /> spurious, no bars released, so we sent the nets back down (500 mwo).<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M8\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdRing station to 800m, night.\ufffd\ufffd Station 3.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 8, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd From 540-640 meters, angle \ufffd\ufffd<br /> dropped off to ~18 deg. for no apparent reason.\ufffd\ufffd Flow also dropped.\ufffd\ufffd (Bad tow.)\ufffd\ufffd All nets closed \ufffd\ufffd<br /> before got to surface.\ufffd\ufffd Net response also did not work.\ufffd\ufffd Not sure can get much out of samples.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd<br /> \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdMorning after examination showed that the top of net 0 had broken loose (another snap \ufffd\ufffd<br /> ring failed).\ufffd\ufffd This probably explains why sudden angle change to 18 deg. occurred while shooting \ufffd\ufffd<br /> the net.\ufffd\ufffd Check of net response indicator showed nothing wrong with reed switch and apparently \ufffd\ufffd<br /> nothing wrong with the wire and connectors.\ufffd\ufffd One of the male EO plugs was corroded and this \ufffd\ufffd<br /> may possibly have caused a bad connection in the pressure case bulk head connector. \ufffd\ufffd<br /> \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSpent day of 9 Aug. refitting net bars and upgrading electrical cables.\ufffd\ufffd Main wires from \ufffd\ufffd<br /> CTD to conductivity cable were not up to par, too much resistance.\ufffd\ufffd This was probably \ufffd\ufffd<br /> responsible for varying strength of signal received at computer.<br /> *Note Sept. 4, 1975: We found that net 1 closed and net 2 opened at about 755m depth without a \ufffd\ufffd<br /> command from the surface.\ufffd\ufffd This explains problem with nets all being closed at the surface.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd<br /> Samples probably all ok except 100m to surface was not sampled on this tow.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M9\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdRing station, night.\ufffd\ufffd Station 3.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 9, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd Tow no good.\ufffd\ufffd I turned computer on for \ufffd\ufffd<br /> this one (first time).\ufffd\ufffd Motor drive did not work.\ufffd\ufffd Aborted tow after trying 2 nets.\ufffd\ufffd Reset on deck, \ufffd\ufffd<br /> tested, and sent down attain for MOC#10.\ufffd\ufffd Single oblique sample prescued (sic?).<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M10\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdRing station to 200m, night.\ufffd\ufffd Station 3.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 9, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd Note time on print out is 1100 \ufffd\ufffd<br /> instead of 2300.\ufffd\ufffd Beautiful tow.\ufffd\ufffd No failures apparent at end.\ufffd\ufffd [Very little data recovered from 9-<br /> track tape: njc, 3/1/04]<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M11\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdRing station to 800m, day.\ufffd\ufffd Station 3.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 10, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd Started \ufffd\ufffd" tape at 8362-8, then \ufffd\ufffd<br /> turn off.\ufffd\ufffd 0932: start tape again.\ufffd\ufffd Had some trouble with computer print out.\ufffd\ufffd Lost net volume for \ufffd\ufffd<br /> net 4.\ufffd\ufffd Tow excellent in all other respects.\ufffd\ufffd Pressure offset = 4.0m on surface coming up.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd<br /> Usually 6.0 going down.\ufffd\ufffd Sample from net #1 lost \ufffd\ufffd bucket fell off.<br /> [poor retrieval from 9-track, very little data: njc, 3/1/2004]<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M12\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSargasso Sea to 200m, day.\ufffd\ufffd Station 4.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 11, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd 11 August.\ufffd\ufffd Tape on at 905,48, \ufffd\ufffd<br /> reading 0000),\ufffd\ufffd Down to 240 m with net 0\ufffd\ufffd let it stabilize, then hauled in at 8m/min and opened \ufffd\ufffd<br /> net 1 at 200m.\ufffd\ufffd Beautiful.<br /> [poor retrieval from 9-track, very little data: njc, 3/1/2004]<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M13\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSargasso Sea to 800m, day.\ufffd\ufffd Station 4.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 11, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd Net put in water but Ortner \ufffd\ufffd<br /> forgot to pull flow meter string so had to bring it back to surface. Ortner then pulled string in air so \ufffd\ufffd<br /> got 16 flow counts or 84 m^3 in air.\ufffd\ufffd Stop recorder at 1216 (260m) will restart on upswing.\ufffd\ufffd Angle \ufffd\ufffd<br /> of net dropped to 20's once net was below 300m so I had ship speed up to 2.5 kts.\ufffd\ufffd During tow, \ufffd\ufffd<br /> sky clouded up and by end of tow rain pouring.\ufffd\ufffd Sea still calm.<br /> [poor retrieval from 9-track, data seems to be from 50m above sea level to 400m below: njc, \ufffd\ufffd<br /> 3/1/2004]<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M14\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSargasso Sea to 800m, night.\ufffd\ufffd Station 4.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 12, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd Had a hard time getting nets \ufffd\ufffd<br /> down.\ufffd\ufffd Paid out 2300m wire rather than usual 1900.\ufffd\ufffd Came in at 25 m/min.\ufffd\ufffd Calculations indicate \ufffd\ufffd<br /> that net was moving about 3 kts at 200-600m depth, ship's speed ~1.9kts.\ufffd\ufffd Net 6 cod end bucket \ufffd\ufffd<br /> broke under water, sample lost.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M15\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSargasso Sea to 800m, night.\ufffd\ufffd Station 4.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 13, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd Tow to replace net 6 from \ufffd\ufffd<br /> MOC-14, 300-200m.\ufffd\ufffd One net response going into the water before it hit the water.\ufffd\ufffd Only 1 net to \ufffd\ufffd<br /> be fished.\ufffd\ufffd No net responses.\ufffd\ufffd Tow no good \ufffd\ufffd net opened and closed together.\ufffd\ufffd No sample.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M16\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSlope Water to 200m, night.\ufffd\ufffd Station 5.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 14, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd Turned on \ufffd\ufffd" tape t 2005-43 at \ufffd\ufffd<br /> 75m depth going down.\ufffd\ufffd This tow went well.\ufffd\ufffd Had small problem with NR not clearing NC and flow \ufffd\ufffd<br /> but it was decided that it had to do with signal fading in and out rather than malfunction down in \ufffd\ufffd<br /> underwater unit.\ufffd\ufffd Pressure offset formula in CTD acquisition program appears to be incorrect and \ufffd\ufffd<br /> we have 2.75m error in the corrected depths on the computer tapes and printouts.\ufffd\ufffd All data \ufffd\ufffd<br /> collected to date have error is MOC 1 to 16.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M17\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSlope Water to 200m, day.\ufffd\ufffd Station 5.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 15, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd" tape started at 1012-15, 154m \ufffd\ufffd<br /> depth.\ufffd\ufffd Had problems with data acquisition 9-track tape.\ufffd\ufffd Didn't get header on or 1st 12 to 15 \ufffd\ufffd<br /> records.\ufffd\ufffd This will mean some data processing problems with CTD3 program.\ufffd\ufffd We came up twice \ufffd\ufffd<br /> as fast on th8is haul as on previous 0-200m hauls to reduce amount of catch somewhat.\ufffd\ufffd Looks \ufffd\ufffd<br /> like a very nice haul.\ufffd\ufffd Pressure offset wrong as noted in M16.\ufffd\ufffd Two files on mag. Tape 1st file is \ufffd\ufffd<br /> data, 2nd file is header.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M18\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSlope Water to 800m, day.\ufffd\ufffd Station 5.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 15, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd" tape on at 1231 for up trace.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd<br /> Had hard time flying this net to depth and getting it to stabilize.\ufffd\ufffd Ship was slowed down too much \ufffd\ufffd<br /> and when we started hauling the net in, it rose very slowly.\ufffd\ufffd Except for deep fishing, this tow went \ufffd\ufffd<br /> well.\ufffd\ufffd Pressure offset wrong as noted in M16.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M19\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSlope Water (edge of Gulf Stream) to 800m, night.\ufffd\ufffd Station 5.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 15, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd" tape on \ufffd\ufffd<br /> 2037 when net 0 started to be hauled in.\ufffd\ufffd Plot of temp and salinity versus depth: black=down \ufffd\ufffd<br /> trace and blue = up trace.\ufffd\ufffd Very nice tow.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M20\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSlope Water to 800m, night.\ufffd\ufffd Station 5.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 16, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd Two deep nets fished in 150m \ufffd\ufffd<br /> intervals so that we could sample upper 100m in 2 steps: 100-50 and 50-0 where there is a \ufffd\ufffd<br /> pronounced thermal break and start of thermocline.\ufffd\ufffd 10.55C @ 50m.\ufffd\ufffd Looks like a good tow.\ufffd\ufffd Net \ufffd\ufffd<br /> moving through water at ~3 kts for most of tow.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M21\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSlope Water to 800m, day.\ufffd\ufffd Station 6.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 17, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd" tape started at bottom of tow.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd<br /> Black=down trace; green=up trace.\ufffd\ufffd Very nice tow; no problems.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd<br /> M22\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffdSlope Water horizontal tow at 350m, day.\ufffd\ufffd Station 6.\ufffd\ufffd Aug. 17, 1975.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd" tape started on \ufffd\ufffd<br /> 1227.\ufffd\ufffd Had a problem with frame synch which coincided with net command on net 1.\ufffd\ufffd As a result, \ufffd\ufffd<br /> lost 2 min. of recording and in process of getting synch back we dropped net 1 and opened net 2.\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd<br /> Beautiful tow after initial problem.\ufffd\ufffd Net frame stayed within 350 +/- 1 meter.<br /> \ufffd\ufffd</p> <p>\ufffd\ufffd</p></div></odo:hasAcquisitionDescription>     <dc:identifier rdf:datatype="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#anyURI">http://www.bco-dmo.org/dataset-deployment/552261.rdf</rdfs:seeAlso>   </rdf:Description>    <rdf:Description
